Very fun and addicting game if you really get into it. It doesnt even matter if you have friends or not for this game. Because even if you dont most people you play with are going to help you and communicate to you someway especially at higher ranks. Most of my time on the game has been with a friend and most of the time we have a blast and others i call him a dumb ass for messing up the generator or heals therefore bringing the killer upon us. I've also had tons of fun with the killer even though I cant play with my friend unless I want it to just be me and him in custom games.(which isn't as fun without a full lobby) Killer is usually tons of fun and can be frustrating at some times but when you get a mind juke on a survivor you feel like fucking Stephen Hawking that could run and talk. Although there our its down falls and most of it comes from the community. Examples our Camping killers which ruin the whole vibe and makes basically everyone depress if they tried to save the survivor. Toxic survivors who chat mean things after matches making me feel like I got a tiny dick with herpes and crabs all over it. But I usually don't find those matches as much as the generally good matches so take some of it with a grain of salt and give another round a try.

If you're looking for a game review you came to the wrong place, but if you're looking for a spaghetti recipe you then came to the right place.


1 pound ground beef

1 medium onion, chopped

4 cloves garlic, minced

1 small green bell pepper, diced

1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes

1 (16 ounce) can tomato sauce

1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste

2 teaspoons dried oregano

2 teaspoons dried basil

1 teaspoon salt

½ teaspoon ground black pepper

Step 1
Combine ground beef, onion, garlic, and green pepper in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook and stir until meat is browned and crumbly and vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain grease.

Step 2
Stir diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and tomato paste into the pan. Season with oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Simmer spaghetti sauce for 1 hour, stirring occasionally.

I can't believe I haven't written a review for DBD before. It's one of my all time favourite games. Fairly well balanced to play as either killer or survivor now, loads of character options, upgrades etc. It's a really fun competitive and co-operative game at the same time which I love. I'm shocked that after all this time it still manages to scare me every once in a while and every time they introduce a new Killer and Survivor combo, it really makes things fresh again. bEhavior has really found a great balance with the game and they time the new releases perfectly to keep me wanting to play. Also, for the most part the community is awesome! I'd say 90% of all matches end in congratulations and some enjoyable chat. Can't recommend this game enough!
Topissimo

If you're familar with a lot of the dead by daylight youtubers, Then you probably have had a peek at the toxicity the game appears to have. It's quite true, Early survivor ranks will be left with suicide teammates who kill themselves on the hook when things go awry and end game for killers, You'll be harassed by either twitch streamers or that one survivor that had the terrible luck of being hooked by you multiple times. 

Early matchmaking for killers was nothing but waiting 10+ minutes for a game, and due to the poor matchmaking I was tossed in with high rank players such as 4's, 3's and even sometimes 1's. Leaving me to get totally flattened by the experienced survivors. Once I finally hit my 10's in ranks, I was pitted against survivors with cross-skills from other characters while I was only stuck with the default perks on a killer. Attempting to play a new killer was also a terrible idea, as there was hardly any good skills for them. 

And if you're looking to really get the best of things, Then you're stuck having to purchase the DLC characters through $ or grinding ingame for credits. After 34 hours of playing, I only had 2k of same credits while something costed 20000 to get. 

What really butters my bread is the fact after I hit rank 7 and realized I was totally unprepared for the level gap of playing against 4 man survivor teams, I wanted to find a way to sabotage my own rank so I can go back to people with my own skill level. Sadly this is either meant by three things, Playing a new killer that you want to have fun trying, get dunked on and t-bagged (Just a bit of ingame toxic moves) and even get some comments in the after game chat. 

Another option is just not trying, but players are able to report you for throwing games. 

Another option which I feel the best for the most cynical of lads do (Such as myself) is just dead on leaving the game at round start to lose enough 'pips' to derank a level. The developers felt for the average joe, This is bannable worthy while a majority of streamers they sponsor can do it will-nilly without any punishments from what I've been watching.  

Some things I can suggest is a way to self-derank yourself to an extent instead of having to do ban worthy options because the matchmaker is like cock and ball torture without the cock and balls. (Depending on your total number of character levels, killer and survivor) 

Find a way to reward killers who go against SWF's (Survive with friends) with more blood points as they tend to have much better communication through discord and enjoy providing the CBT.

The game CAN be fun, but can also be quite frustrating. One game might be fun and a "proper" challenge, the next 3 you may be steamrolled. The system is set up to allow ppl of vastly diff experience levels to play together and that can be a big deterrent. BUT if you have a thick skin and just play not reguarding win or lose, its not too bad, and more fun as survivor if you play with a friend, or friends. I personally think the survive with friends option is OP as hell if its 3-4 <using voice chat> if its only 2, usually not that big a disruption, but it overrides a lot of systems in the game. for example there are "perks" you must earn that can help you see where others, or the killer are. SWF completely sidesteps the necessity of that, as you can simply tell your friends where you are or if you see killer.

Induces terror and enjoyment at the same time. The only issue I have with this game isn't even with the game itself--sometimes your teammates can be the death of you...but even then it can lead to some interesting maneuvers. I definitely recommend.

Edit: After playing this game for over 400 hours, it's safe to say the amount of sweat my body produces whilst playing this game is unhealthy and I should likely see my doctor. I didn't think I would get so hooked with this game, but I'm so so glad I didn't put it away. My tips for you are to: Learn how to loop, learn what the perks do, help your team survive, and keep the toxicity to a minimum lol. 

Now if we're talking about the mechanics of this game, it still needs polishing. Hitboxes are broken, which everyone on here who has played for a long time can tell you. The ebony mori is perhaps the dumbest offering in the game and should be taken out, along with keys, or they should be redesigned to take time to use. Besides those things, I did have some issues where I installed the game on my HDD rather than my SSD and it created frame drops, but reinstalling it back to the SDD fixed it right away. 

Edit: I now have just under 2k hours. Terrible game, buy it if you dare. Definitely recommend

Incredible game, but I feel like it's a quite a bit grindy to get perks at the moment. You don't get many Iridescent Shards per level to spend them on the Shrine of Secrets and I really think there should be other ways of obtaining them. Matchmaking *can* be a bit unfair at times as I've ran in to games where the killer/survivors have the best perks at the lowest Survivor Rank.

Other than that, the game is incredibly fun after you begin to understand the game sense and start winning matches, both on the Killer and Survivor ends. 8/10, highly recommended playing with friends.
